label: FGSD002
info_overview: The Fibaro Smoke Sensor is a universal, optical Z-Wave smoke detector. Fire alarm is signaled by sound, visual indicator blinking and by sending Z-Wave alarm and control commands
info_inclusion:
1. Install the battery. Visual indicator will signal the Z-Wave network inclusion status (red - device ready for inclusion, green - device included, remove firstly - see p. II).
  2. Make sure the device is located within direct range of the Z-Wave controller.
  3. Set the main controller into the learning mode (see main controller’s operating manual).
  4. Quickly, triple click the B-button, located on Fibaro Smoke Sensor’s casing.
  5. Fibaro Smoke Sensor will be detected and included in the Z-Wave network
info_exclusion:
1. Make sure the sensor is connected to battery.
  2. Set the main controller into the learning mode (see main controller’s operating manual)
  3. Quickly, triple click the B-button, located on Fibaro Smoke Sensor’s casing.
info_usage:
BATTERY REPLACEMENT PROCEDURE
Once a Fibaro Smoke Sensor has reported low battery level or battery is
discharged, it should be replaced observing the following procedure:

  1. Detach the sensor from its cover by turning the device counter-clockwise.
  2. Remove the flat battery from the device. Then press and hold the B-button for 3 seconds.
  3. Insert a new CR123A battery observing the polarities shown inside. Visual indicator will signal Z-Wave network inclusion status (green - device included, red - device not included).
  4. Test Fibaro Smoke Sensor’s operation by performing a self-test (see p. VI).
  5. Attach the device into the cover by turning clockwise.

Self-test may be triggered manually

  1. Make sure the device is powered by the battery
  2. Press and hold the B-button. The visual indicator will glow white and the short alarm will sound. Keep holding the B-button. After 3 seconds from the first beep smoke chamber operation will be checked.

Triggering fire alarm and beep mean positive result and should occur within 10 seconds. No fire alarm means that the sensor is malfunctioning.

parameters.label: Smoke Sensor sensitivity
parameters.description: There are 3 levels of sensitivity to smoke presence.
parameters.overview: Level 1 means the highest sensitivity. Rising the parameter value lowers the sensitivity to smoke presence.

parameters.label: Z-Wave notifications status
parameters.description: This parameter allows to activate excess temperature ...
parameters.overview: ...  and/or enclosure opening notifications sent to the main controller

parameters.label: Z-Wave notifications status
parameters.description: This parameter allows to activate excess temperature ...
parameters.overview: ...  and/or enclosure opening notifications sent to the main controller

parameters.label: Visual indicator notifications status
parameters.description: This parameter allows to activate visual indications
parameters.overview:
but does not apply to major alarms, such as FIRE, TROUBLE and LOW BATTERY ALARM.

Available settings: 0 - 7

options.label: Enclosure opening notification enabled +
options.overview: exceeding temperature threshold notification enabled  + lack of Z-Wave range notification

parameters.label: Sound notifications status
parameters.description: This parameter allows to activate sound signals...
parameters.overview: but does not apply to major alarms, such as FIRE, TROUBLE and LOW BATTERY ALARM.

options.label: Enclosure opening notification enabled and
options.overview: exceeding temperature threshold notification enabled  and  lack of Z-Wave range notification

parameters.label: Config of control frames in BASIC command class
parameters.description: This parameter defines which frames will be sent ...
parameters.overview: in the 2-nd Association Group (SMOKE ALARM). The values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF frames may be defined as described in further parameters.

options.label: BASIC ON and BASIC OFF enabled

parameters.label: BASIC ON frame value
parameters.description: BASIC ON frame is sent in case of smoke presence detection ...
parameters.overview: and FIRE ALARM triggering. Its value is defined by the parameter. Available settings: 0-99, 255. 0 - turn off the device. 1-99 - set the device to 1-99%. 255 - set the last status

parameters.label: BASIC OFF frame value
parameters.description: BASIC OFF frame is sent in case of FIRE ALARM cancellation.
parameters.overview: Its value is defined by the parameter. Available settings: 0-99, 255. 0 - turn off the device. 1-99 - set the device to 1-99%. 255 - set the last status

parameters.label: Alarm broadcast
parameters.description: A value other than 0 means that alarms are being ...
parameters.overview: ... sent in broadcast mode, i.e. to all devices within a Fibaro Smoke Sensor’s range

options.label: FIRE ALARM broadcast 2nd/4th Association Group...
options.overview: active; enclosure opening notification broadcast (3-rd & 5-th Association Group) inactive

options.label: FIRE ALARM broadcast 2nd/4th Association Group ...
options.overview: inactive; enclosure opening notification broadcast (3-rd & 5-th Association Group) active

options.label: FIRE ALARM broadcast 2nd/4th Association Group...
options.overview: active; enclosure opening notification broadcast (3-rd & 5-th Association Group) active.

parameters.label: Temperature report interval
parameters.description: Time interval between consecutive temperature reports.
parameters.overview:
Report is sent when new temperature value is different from the one previously reported - according to the set hysteresis (parameter 21). Temperature reports can be also sent as a result of polling.

Available settings: 0, 1-8640 (multiply by 10 seconds) [10s-24h]

0 – reports inactive
1-8640 - [10s-24h]

Default setting: 1 (10 seconds)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: Temperature report hysteresis
parameters.description: The temperature report will only be sent if there is a difference ...
parameters.overview:
in temperature value from the previous value reported, defined in this parameter (hysteresis). Temperature reports can be also sent as a result of polling.

Available settings: 1 – 100 (in 0,1oC steps)
1-100 - (multiply by 0,1) [0,1oC - 10oC]

Default setting: 10 (1oC)
Parameter size: 1 [byte]

parameters.label: Temperature threshold
parameters.overview:
This is the temperature threshold, measured by the internal sensor above which the excess temperature notification is sent (visual indication/sound/Z-Wave report).

Note that the alarm will not be deactivated again until the temperature drops by at least 2 degrees below this threshold.

parameters.label: Excess temperature signaling interval
parameters.description: Time interval of signaling (visual indication/sound) excess ...
parameters.overview:
temperature level


Available settings: 1-8640 (multiply by 10 seconds) [10s-24h]
1-8640 - [10s-24h]

Default setting: 1 (10 seconds)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

parameters.label: Lack of Z-Wave range indication interval
parameters.description: Time interval of signaling (visual indication/sound) lack of ...
parameters.overview:
Z-Wave range.


Available settings: 1-8640 (multiply by 10 seconds) [10s-24h]
1-8640 - [10s-24h]

Default setting: 180 (30min)
Parameter size: 2 [bytes]

associations.label: Smoke Alarm
associations.overview: Sending the BASIC SET control command once smoke is detected. Its value may be modified in advanced parameters (see section XVI in manual). Group may control up to five on/off devices.

associations.label: Tamper Alarm TYPE =BURGLAR, EVENT
associations.overview: Sending the notification NOTIFICATION REPORT (TYPE =BURGLAR, EVENT = PRODUCT COVERING REMOVED) to associated devices once casing opening is detected. Up to five devices supporting casing opening command (NOTIFICATION REPORT) may be included in this group.

associations.label: Fire Alarm
associations.overview: Sending the notification SENSOR ALARM REPORT (TYPE= SMOKE ALARM) to associated devices once smoke is detected. Up to five devices supporting SMOKE ALARM command may be included in this group

associations.label: Tamper Alarm TYPE =GENERAL
associations.overview: Sending SENSOR ALARM REPORT notification (TYPE =GENERAL) to associated devices once casing opening is detected. Up to five devices supporting SENSOR ALARM REPORT command may be included in this group.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

channels.name: alarm_smoke
channels.label: Smoke Alarm
channels.overview:
removed event specfic

event 3 is test button smoke alarm

event  2 is real smoke
